titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Western family scrapbooks 1985.009
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:11 +0000.

did.abstract: Three scrapbooks of clippings, photographs, and a variety of ephemera related to the Western family and Brooklyn events, places, and clubs. Some national figures and events are also represented. Materials span the period circa 1880 to 1932. Henry M. Western was a New York City musician. He, and later, his daughters, performed at various concerts and cultural events in Brooklyn.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Henry M. Western was a New York City musician. He, and later, his daughters, performed at various concerts and cultural events in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Western family scrapbooks, 1985.009, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three scrapbooks of clippings, photographs, and a variety of ephemera related to the Western family and Brooklyn events, places, and clubs. Some national figures and events are also represented. Materials span the period circa 1880 to 1932.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Frances Fowler Samans, 1984. Formally accessioned in 1985.
